articles.headline: UBS Finds Limited Tax Fraud Involving Wealthy Americans
articles.snippet: An inquiry by the Swiss banking giant is looking at fraud cases involving American clients.
articles.abstract: An inquiry by the Swiss banking giant is looking at fraud cases involving American clients.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON  UBS has discovered only a small number of tax-fraud cases as part of an investigation into whether the Swiss bank helped clients dodge American taxes, the bank’s chairman, Peter Kurer, said Thursday.

articles.headline: The Prestigious Design of Ferrari’s Factory
articles.snippet: Ferrari is highlighting a brand and underscoring a claim to luxury style through the innovation of a factory design.
articles.abstract: Ferrari is highlighting a brand and underscoring a claim to luxury style through the innovation of a factory design.
articles.lead_paragraph: MARANELLO, Italy  To walk through the back gate of the Ferrari automotive works here and stroll down Viale Enzo Ferrari is to enter a museum of architecture. To the left is a wind tunnel designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, a soaring tangle of immense gray tubes and cubes where Ferrari’s ear-splitting, nerve-tickling, expensive automobiles are tested for aerodynamic properties.

articles.headline: Copper’s Every Dip Is Felt in Arizona
articles.snippet: Demand for copper revived Arizona’s mining towns but the cooling economy is undoing some of that.
articles.abstract: Demand for copper revived Arizona’s mining towns but the cooling economy is undoing some of that.
articles.lead_paragraph: MORENCI, Ariz.  For this isolated mining town, which lives and dies by the price of copper, the last few years have been a roller coaster ride of steep climbs and sudden dips. Over all, however, the direction seemed to be up.

articles.headline: Got a Room? Inauguration Is a Windfall
articles.snippet: As Washington gears up for the historic inauguration, some are charging steep prices to rent out their homes.
articles.abstract: As Washington gears up for the historic inauguration, some are charging steep prices to rent out their homes.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  It’s the capital’s newest parlor game, literally: How much is your parlor worth?

articles.headline: An End Run Around Realogy’s Lenders
articles.snippet: After the housing bubble burst, a struggle is now emerging over how Realogy’s unfortunate lenders should be treated.
articles.abstract: After the housing bubble burst, a struggle is now emerging over how Realogy’s unfortunate lenders should be treated.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was as badly timed a takeover as there was during the private equity boom.

articles.headline: The Minimal Impact of a Big Hypertension Study
articles.snippet: Critics say drug firms worked to discredit a clinical trial that found that inexpensive pills for hypertension worked better than newer drugs.
articles.abstract: Critics say drug firms worked to discredit a clinical trial that found that inexpensive pills for hypertension worked better than newer drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The surprising news made headlines in December 2002. Generic pills for high blood pressure, which had been in use since the 1950s and cost only pennies a day, worked better than newer drugs that were up to 20 times as expensive.

articles.headline: Retailers Cut Prices, Early and Late
articles.snippet: Retailers are expected to offer jaw-dropping deals during one of the toughest holiday seasons in decades.
articles.abstract: Retailers are expected to offer jaw-dropping deals during one of the toughest holiday seasons in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: Black Friday, long the Super Bowl of shopping, is at hand, but it may have become nearly irrelevant. Check out the deals that were already on offer earlier this week:

articles.headline: India’s Suspicion of Pakistan Clouds U.S. Strategy
articles.snippet: The attacks seem likely to hamper America’s project of promoting reconciliation between India and Pakistan.
articles.abstract: The attacks seem likely to hamper America’s project of promoting reconciliation between India and Pakistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The terrorist attacks in Mumbai occurred as India and Pakistan, two big, hostile and nuclear-armed nations, were delicately moving toward improved relations with the encouragement of the United States and in particular the incoming Obama administration.

articles.headline: Mumbai Terrorist Siege Over, India Says
articles.snippet: Indian commandos took control of the Taj Mahal Palace & Tower in Mumbai after a lengthy assault, the head of the commando unit said in a news conference.
articles.abstract: Indian commandos took control of the Taj Mahal Palace & Tower in Mumbai after a lengthy assault, the head of the commando unit said in a news conference.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India  Indian commandos took control of the Taj Mahal Palace & Tower, the last nest of terrorist resistance, on Saturday morning, after a lengthy assault that left three terrorists dead and sections of the hotel in flames, the head of the commando unit said in a televised news conference.
articles.byline: By Somini Sengupta and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: All Eyes on Holiday Shopping Turnout in Bleak Economy
articles.snippet: The nation’s retailers are facing weak sales, reluctant customers and the prospect of the worst holiday shopping season in decades.
articles.abstract: The nation’s retailers are facing weak sales, reluctant customers and the prospect of the worst holiday shopping season in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a sign of consumer desperation amid a bleak economy, the annual rite of retailing known as Black Friday turned chaotic and even deadly, as predawn shoppers scrambled for holiday bargains.
